intro: Notelaea longifolia var. candolleana, commonly known as the Candolleana notelaea, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Australia. It belongs to the Proteaceae family, which is characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers. The plant typically features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is adapted to dry, coastal environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
